<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
         http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-plugin</artifactId>
    <version>999-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>maven-plugin</packaging>

    <properties>
        <maven.compiler.source>11</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>11</maven.compiler.target>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.version>3.8.8</maven.version>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <!-- Maven Plugin API -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-plugin-api</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugin-tools</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-plugin-annotations</artifactId>
            <version>3.9.0</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- Maven Core for MavenSession -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-core</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- Maven Project -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-model</artifactId>
            <version>${maven.version}</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- JSON output -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.code.gson</groupId>
            <artifactId>gson</artifactId>
            <version>2.10.1</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.11.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>11</source>
                    <target>11</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-plugin-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.9.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <goalPrefix>nx</goalPrefix>
                </configuration>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>default-descriptor</id>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>descriptor</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>

content.text:
Perfect! The graph is now working. I fixed the issue by:

1. **Identifying the problem**: The Maven plugin was using an incorrect goal reference `io.quarkus:maven-plugin:analyze` which didn't exist
2. **Finding the correct coordinates**: The plugin is `io.quarkus:maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:analyze`
3. **Building the plugin**: Ensured the Maven plugin was compiled with `mvn clean install`
4. **Testing the fix**: Verified the graph generation now works successfully

The Nx workspace now shows 1669 Maven projects from the Quarkus repository. You can run `nx graph` to see the visual project graph.

content.text:
Perfect! Now whenever someone runs `npm install` or `pnpm install`, the Maven plugin will automatically be built. The `-q` flag keeps it quiet to avoid cluttering the install output.

The postinstall script will:
1. Navigate to the `maven-plugin` directory
2. Run `mvn clean install -q` to build and install the plugin
3. This ensures the plugin is available for the Nx graph generation
